TextView.android:text: Despite being dead for over a year, famous author Agatha Christie saved a baby's life in 1977. Her novel The Pale Horse described thallium poisoning so well that a nurse who's been reading it was able to diagnose a sick infant, who had doctors stumped. The baby was immediately tested, they found traces of thallium, doctors changed treatments, and her life had suddenly been saved by a 16-year-old murder mystery novel.
